item.title: Analytics engineering: practical workflow
item.description: A simple workflow for reliable analytics without over-engineering.
item.content:encoded:
A dependable analytics workflow is built on three loops:

  • Instrument: agree on event names, ownership, and validation.
  • Model: create a canonical dataset that business users trust.
  • Decide: make outcomes visible with a short summary and next step.

If you keep the loop tight, stakeholders stay aligned and the data keeps its value.

item.title: Data story: turning metrics into decisions
item.description: A short framework for connecting metrics to real decisions.
item.content:encoded:
When a dashboard is busy but decisions are still slow, the missing piece is often a clear decision loop. A useful structure is:

  1. Signal: define the metric that tells you something changed.
  2. Diagnosis: identify what likely caused the change.
  3. Action: list the choices that are now on the table.
  4. Cost: what does it cost to be wrong?
  5. Decision: what will you do, and when?

This keeps analysis focused on action and prevents endless metric churn.

item.title: Building a portfolio with Gatsby
item.description: Why Gatsby is a friendly entry point for a React-based portfolio.
item.content:encoded:
Gatsby is a solid first React framework because it is static-first, easy to host, and still gives you the component model you will use everywhere else.

My focus for this build was:

  • A clean content structure with Markdown for posts.
  • A working RSS feed.
  • Lightweight data files for projects and videos.

Once content is stable, the same structure can move to Next.js later with minimal disruption.
